name: Excellence Riviera Cancun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a great deal at the Excellence through ebookers and were not disappointed. I had spent ages scouring tripadvisor looking for the perfect honeymoon destination for us after our wedding in New Zealand. In the end I could not have picked a better resort!
reviews.title: Excellent Excellence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had been concerned that the resort would be too big and crowded for a honeymoon but not at all - there was plenty of space and loads of places to retreat and at no point did you feel you needed to mingle or join in group activities (unless you wanted to).We just had a standard room on the 2nd floor over looking the pool but this was beautiful and I was glad we didnt spend the extra on a swim up room as these felt less private and what we got was so lovely, big bed, lovely spa pool, great balcony. Pools, beach and spa were all lovely and cannot imagine how anyone could find fault with the facilities.
reviews.title: Excellence Revisited

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having never stayed all incluisive before we were worried about the quality of the food/drinks however it was all really good. Spice restaurant was the asian restuarant and was our favourite. The pizza lunch and salad buffet was also very good and breakfast had so much variety I always ate too much. Fav drinks were the Excellence Martini and the Miami Vice cocktail.
reviews.title: Absolutely Brilliant - in the words of friends we met... :-)

We were pleasantly and happily surprised how nice the resort and beach at Excellence Riviera Cancun are! We would definitely return to Excellence Riviera Cancun. It was so relaxing and comfortable. Excellence Riviera Cancun is one of the better All Inclusive resorts in Cancun.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is above excellent from preparation to presentation. I was given a spontaneous tour of the kitchen and food areas. Again impeccable, all staff were crisp and clean. There were mulitiple handwashing, sanitizing stations and sinks. All stainless steel conditions, with all areas polished. Foods are held in separate temperature controlled rooms with full glass windows for supervisory observation. The rooms are organized by fruits, vegetables, meat types, seafood, fish and pastries. There are no chances for cross contamination.
reviews.title: Near Flawless All Inclusive Mexican Vacation Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I personally have only stayed in the Excellence Level for room choices. The Ocean Front Junior Suite is wonderful. This last visit we stayed in the Honeymoon Suite. (Please see attached photo's). The difference between the two rooms is: The Junior Suite does not have a massage room, the sitting area or livingroom is about half the size of the Honeymoon Suite. Please note in both Suites you do have a Jacuzzi Tub for Two, both inside your room and also on your private outdoor balcony.

reviews.title: Loved it!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in building 6c. Paid for the cheapest room and were very happy. We had ocean view in the distance and pool view close. We didn't get the swim up. I emailed the resort and requested to be in building 6a or 6c after reading other forum questions.
reviews.title: Perfect wedding! Exceptional staff! Beautiful resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: We got a couples massage, which was very good. The lazy river around the spa is also very relaxing.
reviews.title: Didn't measure up
Simply Paradise
reviews.text: I just had to finally get this out. This place is FABULOUS. The staff is almost unbelievable in the quality of service they provide--24/7. Every restaurant is special so go to all of them. The cleanliness of the resort is next to none. They are always cleaning, clipping trees, washing walk ways, brushing down the pool. Folks who complain about the smell or as some say mildew just don't get it. IT"S MEXICO.....it's humid, deal with it or don't go. We did not experience mildew--or any bad "smells" so we don't know what some of these folks complain about. The pools are fabulous. We had a swin up room and highly recommend any of those rooms. Room service is 24/7..anything you want....and again, the service is FIVE STAR and delivered by some of the nicest people you will ever meet.

reviews.title: This is the best
reviews.text: YEP---my wife and I know what we are talking about as we have been blessed to have traveled the world and stayed at some of the highest class resorts---but Excellence Cancun beats them all in all aspects of resort accomodations, activities, food and service. You will do what we have done when you get home...you will tell everyone you know that they have got to get there. We did not leave the resort--there is no need to unless you really want to do some shopping.

reviews.title: Unbelievable - Where to Begin!?
Amazing

We booked a well-regarded transport service that got us to the Excellence from the Airport in about 20 minutes. He was hauling incredibly fast on the road and not interested in speeding, turns or being within millimeters of a person's bumper.

reviews.title: AMAZING! We'll be going back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a massive gate with four security guards that check every vehicle coming in and out of the resort. Seemed like solid security in terms of people getting through the front gate, but there are other ways around and in I have found out. At check-in we received a choice of champagne or water with a damp towel. Seemed nice and then a little bit of trouble began. We booked the Excellence Club Oceanfront Suite. We had to wait around fifteen minutes to be taken to the Excellence Club to be checked-in and had to wait for an additional two couples to come with us. The bellman was nice and he felt bad about it, apologizing profusely for making us wait at the Martini Bar. Next, we went with the other clubs and on our way to the club, the bellman introduced us to the resort, whether we wanted to know or not, he showed us where to eat, beaches, pools, bars and dance club. Took about another ten minutes to finally get us to the Excellence Club. Here is where it got real bad...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You will read minor irritations amongst other reviews. Many of them are based on preferences – bed was too hard, room too hot, food not to their liking, etc. I think those should be set aside, but there were some details not consistent with a 5 star resort.
reviews.title: Stunning resort, not so great beach! Would definitely go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm a little late writing my review, but was researching another trip and decided to share my thoughts. My husband and I stayed at the Excellence with another couple and had one of the best and most relaxing vacations we've ever had. We upgraded to the "excellence club" and enjoyed the perks of this added bonus. We didn't spend a ton of time at the non club pool but from what I saw the drink service at the club pool was incredible! I think the only reason we left our beach chairs was to head into the pool or use the bathroom! The food was fantastic and the drinks were strong. Room service was always prompt and happily delivered. Entertainment was great as well. The only "bad" dinner we had was the mexican theme night- def wasn't as good as the other meals we enjoyed. Make sure if you enjoy cigars to head to the cigar bar - you can sit in there and still enjoy the entertainment. The disco club was also fun. The spa was an experience-- def worth the $$! You will not be disappointed here! Can't wait to go back... just trying to decide if we should try another location for fun!
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As the title suggests, we have been to Sandals resorts before - but I have to say that we now prefer Excellence resorts after our experience of ERC.
reviews.title: Sandals - Look Out!

reviews.text: The hotel and grounds were well maintained and looked after by a small army of cleaners, gardeners, and maintenance staff.
reviews.title: Excellence indeed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The 8 restaurants were extremely well themed, and all had a good selection of varied dishes. There are also themed nights on the beach / main plaza (which were so well prepared and carried out) - we were there for 2 weeks and didn't eat in the same place until day 11! Once again, all of the staff in the restaurants were helpful, polite and friendly.
reviews.title: A Fantastic, relaxing and fun vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The 10 bars peppered around the grounds ensured that you were never too far from a cooling cocktail, but frequent rounds from waiters / waitresses ensured that you didn't even have to get up from your sunbed if you didn't want to!
reviews.title: Beyond excellence!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can I say. When we booked our trip we had high expectations and in the end they were all met and surpassed. This resort is simply beautiful, the staff are the best we've come across and the food was outstanding. We are in our late 30's and have travelled to resorts throughout Mexico and the Islands and really nothing even approaches the value of this resort.
reviews.title: Wow! What a great resort.

likes.liked: — Beautiful grounds, spa, pools, rooms and food

reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel - Well Worth the Visit
reviews.text: The Rooms-There is no need to try and switch your room when you get there, they are all 5*+, they all have great views of the pools and some with ocean views. We liked the chocolates and little messages left on our pillows every night. A shower that could easily fit 5 people, no problems at all with water temperature. I didn't want to get out of there...it was so relaxing. All rooms have a good sized jacuzzi, we never used it as there were several outdoor jacuzzi's throughout the resort. Main floor rooms have there own yard and chairs with direct access to one of the many pools on the resort. All rooms above that, have large balconies with a small couch and chairs. The rooms look exactly like the they do on the resort web site. As far as mold and ants, we did not see any. I actually think the hotel is aware of the problem(?) as they wiped are walls down with some type of cleaner before we checked in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Food-We are foody's and booked this resort expecting great food and that was what we experienced. The Italian restaurant ended up being our favourite stop We ate most lunches at the Grill which served fantastic food. I don't quite understand the complaints. The steaks are not up there with Ruth Chris or anything like that, but they were still mouthwatering. The final night we ate at the Lobster House which was excellent, you have to try the Blackened Shrimp as an appetizer, the best I've ever had. Breakfast is served as a buffet, with 2 separate cooking stations....they'll make whatever you feel like and plenty of freshly squeezed juices.
reviews.title: Great Food, Great Service, Great Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room Service- This resort has 24 hour room service and the menu is THICK. You can order just about anything you like and it's in your room in under 30 minutes. I think the menu is about 4-5 pages long and this was probably our favourite thing at the resort. Like I said earlier, we are foody's!
reviews.title: Excellente....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Entertainment/Bars etc- Shows were great, all the entertainmnet takes place in a gorgeous covered theatre, so if it rains at night your covered. Waiters and drinks are everywhere, there is no problem with slow service at this resort. There are bars everywhere so finding a drink in the heat is never a problem. The liquor is all high end, however you should ask for a particular Rum for example otherwise they will pour you the local brand. All drinks are served in glasses, not those tiny disposable plastic cups you normally get at an all-inclusive. There is also a disco that gets quite busy once the entertainment and shows for the night end. We had a great time there. We were a little worried about being stuck at aresort with no night life, but this was not a problem. With adults only and no kids to take care of, we found that almost everyone was out at night to have a good time. We met some very nice people at the resort, it was very friendly and not stuffy at all. Most of the poeple at the resort were from Canada, USA and the UK. so there wasn't much of a language barrier when meeting people. I almost forgot to mention the X-lounge, which is a really cool bar on the beach(sort of South Beach style) where you have your own bed on the ocean with white linens blowing in the wind...very cool. They serve you drinks bedside and the calming music and ocean breeze make this a must.
reviews.title: perfect for first timer; ok for someone more experienced

description: This all-suite, all-adult Resort is set along Mexico's renowned Mayan Riviera, between Playa del Carmen and Cancun, on an immaculate white sand beach. Six meandering pools wind through their grounds. You have unlimited access to eight international restaurants and ten bars, plus such amenities as an expansive swim-in spa, a full-scale fitness and cardio-conditioning center and an unparalleled range of activities on land and sea.
